{
    "number": 219587,
    "data": "1,2,8,40,224,1296,7568,44304,259536,1520656,8910160,52209040,305919696,1792542992,10503446608,61545189520,360625475024,2113093401616,12381720203088,72550979111824,425114158957776,2490966357221136,14595875630354000,85524874633320080",
    "name": "Noncrossing, nonnesting, 2-arc-colored permutations on the set {1..n} where lower arcs even of different colors do not cross.",
    "comment": [
        "The sequence is generated by a rational function, in particular, a quotient of two determinants."
    ],
    "link": [
        "Lily Yen, <a href=\"/A219587/b219587.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000</a>",
        "Lily Yen, <a href=\"http://arxiv.org/abs/1211.3472\">Crossings and Nestings for Arc-Coloured Permutations</a>, arXiv:1211.3472 [math.CO], 2012-2013.",
        "<a href=\"/index/Rec#order_03\">Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients</a>, signature (7,-6,-4)."
    ],
    "formula": [
        "G.f.: (1 - 5*x)/(1 - 7*x + 6*x^2 + 4*x^3).",
        "a(n) = 7*a(n-1) - 6*a(n-2) - 4*a(n-3) for n>2. - _Colin Barker_, Jun 22 2019"
    ],
    "example": [
        "For n=4, the a(4) = 224 solutions are 24 permutations, 8 of which can be colored in 4 ways each, 8 in 8 ways each, and 8 in 16 ways each, thus resulting in 8 * (4+8+16) = 224."
    ],
    "program": [
        "(PARI) Vec((1 - 5*x) / (1 - 7*x + 6*x^2 + 4*x^3) + O(x^40)) \\\\ _Colin Barker_, Jun 22 2019"
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,easy",
    "offset": "0,2",
    "author": "_Lily Yen_, Nov 23 2012",
    "ext": [
        "Name modified by _Lily Yen_, Apr 23 2013"
    ],
    "references": 1,
    "revision": 24,
    "time": "2019-06-22T09:23:55-04:00",
    "created": "2012-11-26T13:00:53-05:00"
}
